                    ### Question
                    Which of the following is the best-known metabolic function of the lung

                    ### Options
                    opa. Inactivation of serotonin
opb. Conversion of angiotensin–I to angiotensin–II
opc. Inactivation of bradykinin
opd. Metabolism of basic drugs by cytochrome P–450 system

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
The best-known metabolic function of the lung is the conversion of angiotensin-I to angiotensin-II. This process is facilitated by the enzyme Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme (ACE), which is highly expressed in the endothelial cells of the lungs. This function is critical in the regulation of blood pressure and fluid balance in the body. While the lungs also participate in the inactivation of serotonin and bradykinin, and contain some cytochrome P-450 enzymes for metabolizing certain substances, these functions are less emphasized and not as well-known as the conversion of angiotensin-I to angiotensin-II. The evidence paths confirm the presence of relevant enzymes in the lungs, supporting their role in these metabolic activities, but the conversion of angiotensin-I to angiotensin-II remains the most prominent and well-documented function.
